subject: Product Launch Date Confirmed
body: Team, we've confirmed the product launch for March 15. Marketing should start the campaign by Feb 20. Bob, please finalize the landing page by Feb 25. I've shared the product spec document in the Drive folder.

subject: Landing Page Update
body: Alice, the landing page will be ready by Feb 25 as requested. I'm waiting on final copy from Dave in content. Also need the API specs from Frank for the pricing calculator.

subject: Marketing Sync Meeting
body: Attendees: Carol, Alice, Bob, Dave. Duration: 45 min. Key discussion: Campaign strategy for product launch. Carol proposed social media push starting Feb 15 across Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Dave raised concern about budget — only $5,000 remaining in Q1 marketing budget. Alice approved additional $3,000 from reserves. Decision: total marketing budget is $8,000. Action items: Dave to prepare content calendar by Jan 20, Carol to finalize ad creatives by Jan 25.

subject: Campaign Copy Ready
body: Carol, I've finished the campaign copy for all three platforms. Docs are in the shared Drive folder under /Marketing/Q1 Campaign/. Also, I heard from Eve in sales that we might push the launch to April 1 instead. Can you confirm with Alice? This would change our entire content calendar.

subject: Client Feedback on Beta
body: Alice, three major clients (GlobalCorp, TechVentures, DataFlow Inc) tested the beta last week. Summary of feedback: 1) Payment flow needs more testing - two clients reported errors. 2) SSO integration is a must-have for enterprise clients. 3) Overall UX rated 4.2/5. Recommendation: push launch to April to address payment issues. Frank in engineering agrees — he needs two more weeks for the payment integration. I've attached the full client feedback report.

subject: Engineering Update
body: Payment integration is behind schedule. Root cause: Stripe API changed their webhook format and we need to rewrite the handler. Realistically need until March 30 to finish. This means the March 15 launch date is not feasible. I recommend April 1. I've updated the engineering roadmap in Notion.

subject: All Hands - Launch Date Decision
body: All-hands meeting called by Alice. Duration: 60 min. All team members present. DECISION: After reviewing engineering timeline and client feedback, the launch date is officially moved from March 15 to April 1. Marketing campaign start date adjusted to March 10. Budget remains $8,000. Frank to deliver final build by March 28. Bob to update landing page by March 25. Eve to notify beta clients of new timeline. Carol to revise campaign schedule. Dave to update content calendar. This decision is final unless engineering encounters further blockers.

subject: Updated Campaign Timeline
body: Dave, updating you — campaign now starts March 10 instead of Feb 20. Please revise the content calendar accordingly. Budget is confirmed at $8,000. I need the revised calendar by Jan 22. Also please update the Campaign Strategy Deck with the new dates.

subject: API Specs Needed
body: Frank, I need the final API specs for the pricing page. The calculator widget depends on the /api/pricing endpoint. Can you send them by next Monday? The landing page is blocked until I get these.

subject: New Enterprise Client Interest
body: Great news — GlobalCorp wants a demo before launch. They could be a $50K annual contract. They specifically want: 1) SSO integration (SAML), 2) Role-based access control, 3) Audit logging. Frank hasn't started SSO yet. Suggest we prioritize their feature requests. I've created a deal tracker in the CRM.

subject: Two More Enterprise Leads
body: Update: TechVentures and DataFlow also want pre-launch demos. Combined potential ARR: $120K. All three need SSO. Frank, what's the realistic timeline for SSO implementation? This could be a game-changer for our Q2 revenue targets.

subject: Enterprise Strategy Discussion
body: Meeting between Alice, Frank, and Eve. Duration: 30 min. Topic: How to handle enterprise client demands vs launch timeline. Frank estimates SSO will take 3 weeks. CONFLICT: Adding SSO could push launch past April 1. Alice's decision: Frank to do a minimal SSO implementation (2 weeks) that covers SAML basics. Full SSO in v1.1 post-launch. Eve to set expectations with clients. Risk: minimal SSO might not satisfy GlobalCorp's security requirements.

subject: Weekly Update from CEO
body: Team, weekly update: 1) Launch date holds at April 1. 2) Frank is working on minimal SSO for enterprise clients. 3) Marketing campaign starts March 10 - Carol and Dave are on track. 4) Three enterprise clients in pipeline worth $120K ARR. 5) Bob's landing page blocked on Frank's API specs - Frank please prioritize. 6) Runway update: we have 8 months of runway. Need to hit $200K ARR by Q3. Let's stay focused and aligned!

subject: Campaign Strategy Deck - Updated
body: Updated the Campaign Strategy Deck with new timeline (March 10 start, April 1 launch). Key changes: 1) Phase 1 (March 10-20): Teaser campaign on social media. 2) Phase 2 (March 20-31): Full campaign with paid ads, blog posts, email sequences. 3) Phase 3 (April 1-15): Launch week blitz. Budget allocation: Social ads $3,000, Content creation $2,000, Email marketing $1,500, Influencer partnerships $1,500. KPIs: 10,000 signups, 500 paid conversions in first month.

subject: API Specs for Pricing Page
body: Bob, here are the API specs for the pricing endpoint. Endpoint: GET /api/v1/pricing. Returns JSON with plan tiers, features, and pricing. I've also included the webhook spec for handling subscription changes. Let me know if you need anything else. Sorry for the delay — was firefighting the Stripe webhook issue.
